author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 18
body:
"Aren't you drinking too much?" Forjan asked him. "I am okay, it's just a little I am drinking," Hali said, grinning widely. Forjan was convinced that the palm wine had got to him. He faced Hali. "Anyway, it's festival down here, even if the master sees you  drinking, tell him, it's  a festival and challenge him that he too has drunk," he said.




That amused Hali and he laughed out loud. "That's is so right Forjan. Every man is a drunk In the presence of palm wine," he said and let out another heavy laughter. The youths around them were amused by the magician's younger boy. They drifted closer to hear his babbling.
root_title: The great magician's magic script 18

author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 17
body:
Forjan refilled the cup and handed it to Hali. He seemed to engrossed in chatting with a youth beside him and not mindful of what Hali was drinking. Reluctantly, Hali took the cup and drank the content. Soon, he wanted more. 



He reached for the keg by himself more wine. Forjan watched him, smiling to himself. Hali would soon be intoxicated and then, he would have failed the master,  he thought. Hali poured again for himself. Forjan reached for the cup in his hand. Hali shoved his hand away. "Leave my cup, let me drink and be merry," Hali said and guffawed.
root_title: The great magician's magic script 17

author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 16
body: "A cup won't harm you, just drink and that will be enough for one day so that you will still remain in check." Hali drank the wine. It tasted sweet and very good in his mouth. Palm wine generally tasted sweet and very good in hali's mouth that was why he loved it so much. He gulped down the entire content in the cup. Forjan smiled to himself. He knew that within few  moments, Hali would crave for more; the fact that he had tasted the palm wine meant that his appetite for alcoholism had been whetted.
root_title: The great magician's magic script 16

author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 15
body:
But then, he thought over Forjan's words, he would not get drunk and the master did not have to know that he even tasted palm wine. He would drink only moderately.

He watched as Forjan poured more of the palm wine into the cup. He swallowed saliva and his desire to drink was heightened. Forjan looked at him and smiled. Then, he passed the cup to him. Hali took it and sat down again. He was hesitant to drink the wine.

"Afterward a good meal, one should use such good and healthy palm wine to wash down the food," Forjan said. He looked at Hali and saw that the boy was reluctant to drink.
root_title: The great magician's magic script 15

author: mojubare
title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy,9
body:
I meet him at where he should meet which was an eatery close-by. I followed his instructions to come alone. He was there looking dapper and sexy. My heart raced as I saw him. He looked at me and beamed a disarming smile at me.
This man was indeed handsome.

Hello, he said.
Hi, I responded as I came close to him. He rose and received me, we sat and he asked me what I cared for while we had lunch.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://cdn-pro.elsalvador.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/07030819/1465484281202.jpg
He kept stealing glancs at me and I was really melting for him. After lunch, he sat and leaned forward and he held my hands, he squeezed them gently and I felt triggers of emotions erupt within me.
Tracy, this is the third time I am seeing you and it just looks as if I have been seeing you all my life.
root_title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy,9

author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 14
body:
"Come on hali, this is a merry festival we are supposed to be enjoying ourselves. Sit, relax and be merry," Forjan said. "No, Hali said. "I have already just eaten and I don't want to drink that wine. It is l ready tempting." "But you are a real man," said forjan. It's a festival here, Sit and enjoy yourself. Make yourself merry, my friend." "I can't. I already promised the master that I will not drink, Hali said.




"The master did not say you should not drink. He only does not want you to be drunk and misbehave. Feel free and drink. I won't mention it to the master, besides, you won't get drunk," Forjan said. He took a gulp from his cup and belched. Such sweet palm wine, sweeter than any that I have ever tasted." That's got Hali tempted and he hungered for a drink. But he was still afraid of what great Kamah would do to him if got drunk.
root_title: The great magician's magic script 14

author: mojubare
title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy,8
body:
He dropped us at home and my cousin just kept talking about him. In fact, during dinner, she had to begin referring to Bosun as her in-law and I could see how thrilled he appeared.
Later that night, Bosun called me and we chatted far into the night. He wasn't like a man I barely knew; he was like someone I had known all for my life.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://cdn-pro.elsalvador.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/07030819/1465484281202.jpg
The following day, I was on my way back from church when my phone rang. It was an unknown number. I picked it, wondering who it was. To my pleasant surprise, it was Bosun; he wanted us to meet.

I meet him at where he said we should meet; an eatery close-by. I followed his instruction to come alone. He was there looking dapper and sexy.
My heart raced as I saw him. He looked at me and beamed a disarming smile at me. This man was very handsome.
root_title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy,8

author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 13
body:
"Palm wine is the spirit of a man, only real men drink palm wine and get merry," he said as he poured a cup for himself. He was not really a drunk or a palm wine lovers. 

Hali was uncomfortable. He was careful not to drink because he knew that if he did and made a fool of himself, his master would be furious.

He looked at forjan and suddenly, he wanted to leave the place to avoid any mistake. He got up Forjan looked at him in shock.

"What is the matter, Hali? Where are you going?" "I want to take a walk and feel the cool breeze in this village," Hali said.
root_title: The great magician's magic script 13

author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 12
body:
"It's up to you, if any of you does not behave himself this time, i may have no other choice than to send that person away and without apology," Great Kamah said. The festival at Agba village was a great one. There were lots of activities with dancing, singing and merriment with plenty of food and drink flowing about. 




Forjan and hali were in the festive mood. After Great Kamah had performed his art on the first day, he let his boy enjoy themselves however, warning them not to misbehave. Forjan had a different thought. He would ensure that he did not misbehave but then, he would make sure that Hali brought shame and embarrassment to their master.




That way, Great Kamah would accord him better attention than Hali and that would help him win the favour of their master. He knew that it was his master's love for him that would give him the baton to the next great magician and he wanted it badly. They were served food and drink. Forjan ate with Hali.He was laughing gaily and loudly. When a keg of palm wine
root_title: The great magician's magic script 12

author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 11
body:
Forjan had demanded that the people paid him first. They did. Unknown to him, the people had earlier come to persuade Great Kamah and he had told them he would not be chanced.



 They felt that Forjan could help talk to him. Forjan tried to talk to the master but Great Kamah had told him it was impossible as he had a more important engagement at that time. He failed to persuade his master and great Kamah did not attend the occasion.




 The people were not happy. They returned to demand for their money which they have paid to forjan. It was then, everything got known and Great Kamah was very upset with him. He had berated him harshly and told him magic was not for dishonest people.



 Though Forjan had pleaded and promised to change, the stigma had remained. Great Kamah never spoke of it until now as they neared Agba village. Great Kamah was though a patient man, he had no tolerance for embarrassment and unfortunately, little things embarrassed him. The boy promised to be of good behaviour.
root_title: The great magician's magic script 11

author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 10
body:
I will do my best to steer clear of palm wine, Hali said. "Master," forjan said, "I have tried to stop him from drinking but I don't understand; Hali is incorrigible when it comes to palm wine". Great Kamah looked at forjan. He sighed as he understood forjan's sentiment.


"You are no better forjan. Ensure that you yourself don't get into mischief nor do anything that you are not supposed to do because I haven't forgotten how you extorted those people at Okhama the other time. I don't want a repetition of that shameful episode or anything within that premise," he said.




Forjan was silent. He knew his master had not forgotten about that episode.the people of Okhama had come to him to help them persuade his master to come to their village to perform. There was going to be a coronation ceremony at the end of that week.
root_title: The great magician's magic script 10

author: mojubare
title: The great magician's magic script 9
body:
One day, the magician went on a journey with forjan and hali to a village called agbado for performance. There was a big festival in agbado and the king of the  village had invited  Great Kamah to enymtertain his people and add color to the festival. On their way to the village, Great Kamah talked to his boys. 
  "Asked we are going to these village, I want the two of you to behave yourself. Don't do anything that would bring shame to me. You must conduct yourself properly," he said and turned to Hali. "Hali, you must not get drunk. You have to overcome drunkenness. Nobody becomes a great magician if he is drunk. A magician has a lot of secrets to keep and no drunk can keep a secret."
Hali bowed his head in shame. He was embarrassed. He did not like being an alcoholic but he did not understand why he could not keep  off from the keg. He just loved to drink. Though man times, he had vowed to himself not to drink again but once he saw a keg of palm wine, he would forget all about it and soak himself in it.....
root_title: The great magician's magic script 9

author: mojubare
title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy, 7
body:
He turned out to be really nice. He stayed with us at the salon until we finished. I was really feeling for him. What would make a guy stay with a lady in the salon, watching her make her hair?
Your answer is as good as mine, it was love. I felt the fluttering of butterflies in my tummy This bloke was in love with me.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://cdn-pro.elsalvador.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/07030819/1465484281202.jpg

Afterwards, he took us out for dinner. It was a very cozy place and my cousin could not hide her excitement. You are a great guy Bosun. Do not worry, in case you want to get married to Tracy, I will make sure she gets married to you. Rita said.

He laughed and looked at me. I won't forget what she has said, he said. I only smiled and pinched my cousin for her nughtiness.
We did not talk much during the dinner but he took my numbers.
root_title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy, 7

author: mojubare
title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 6
body:
If he wants to marry you and he proposes tonight, tell him, yes and if you are not interested, tell him I might be, Rita said.
I laughed. He is a stranger, I don't even know him and are you trying to snatch him already, I said and we have a good laugh.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://cdn-pro.elsalvador.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/07030819/1465484281202.jpg

Rita was one of my favourite relatives, we got along quite well. You know you did not tell me your name, I accused him as Rita and I entered his car..

He smiled. You did not ask me, he said.
So, what is your name? I asked.

Olatubosun, Bosun for short, he said. I pronounced the name. He was impressed that I pronounced it correctly. I have lived in Lagos many years to know how to pronounce Yoruba names well.
root_title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 6

author: mojubare
title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 5
body:
We were actually preparing to go to the saloon before I was informed that I had a visitor, I said.
He dropped. Oh, what a terrible thing is my luck today, he said. 

Then, he shrugged his shoulders. I could take you to the salon and wait for you until you finish your hair, then, we could have a dinner together. He sounded very confident like a man who was a close friend nd I wondered why he had so much guts.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://cdn-pro.elsalvador.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/07030819/1465484281202.jpg

I will advise you don't because you will wait for long. We are going to make our hair, I said.
I have not complained yet, he said.

I accepted his offer, so he went into his car while Rita and I went to pick our bags.
Wow! he is such a bloke, my cousin enthused. She appeared so dreamy.
I smiled. I thought so too the first time I saw him, I said .
root_title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 5

author: mojubare
title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 4
body:
Okay, take care, he said and drove off. I watched him as he drove away, suddenly feeling annoyed. He was too conceited for my liking.
He did not even have the courtesy of telling me his name fter I had told him mine. I entered the house and tried to put him behind me. Although I remember telling my friend Ada in school about him the next day, I however forgot about him sooner.

A fortnight later, it was actually on a Saturday, I ws about to go to the salon with my cousin, Rita when the gateman came to inform me that I had a visitor who was waiting outside. I was surprised because I did not think any of my new friends or collegues knew where I lived.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://cdn-pro.elsalvador.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/07030819/1465484281202.jpg

A visitor to see me? I asked in confusion. Yes, he replied.

I was pleasantly surprised when I went out and found out that the visitor was the same man who had given me a ride the other day.
Hi, it's you, I said gleefully.

He beemed at me. Hello,
root_title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 4

author: mojubare
title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 3
body:
Thank you very much Sir, I said,
He nodded and turned to look at me. All through the ride, I had expected him to talk to me, ask me one or two questions about myself but he did not and I wondered why.

You are welcome, he said. He stretched his arm across me and opened the door for me. I thought it was queer of him but then, what should I care?

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://cdn-pro.elsalvador.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/07030819/1465484281202.jpg

He was a stranger. I got down and thanked him again. I began to walk towards the gate.
Just when I was pushing the gate open, I heard his voice saying, you didn't tell me your name, he hollered.
That's because you didn't ask, I hollered back.

So what is your name, he asked.
I tittered even though I felt awkward that he was talking from a distane and I was reluctant to go to him. I thought if he was not arrogant, he would come down and come over to me.
He did not and I cannot explain what propelled me to tell him.
Tracy, I said.
root_title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 3

author: mojubare
title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 2
body:
I was posted to teach in a school in port-harcout, on my second day I was waiting for bus at the Rumuol when a sleek black car slowed down.
A young handsome face peered out of his car.

Hi, pretty corper; the young man behind the wheel said with a dashing smile that was simply disarming.
I actually felt my legs wobble. This was the most handsome man my eyes had ever seen.

Good afternoon sir, I threw at him. Obviously I did not know him and I made no pretence about it.
Where are you heading, if you do not mind me giving you a lift? he asked.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://cdn-pro.elsalvador.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/07030819/1465484281202.jpg

I am going to Olu Obasanjo in GRA, I said.
He beamed at me. WOW! such a huge coincidence, he said and asked me to enter. I entered the car, it was really comfy and air-conditioned, a thankful escape from the scorching sun outside.

He did not ay a word to me as he drove up the road until we arrived at my destination. He parked the car just outside my uncle
root_title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy 2

author: mojubare
title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy; Script 1
body:
How have I let just one mistake ruin my whole life? why did I do it? these are the questions I keep asking myself every day.
Today, I am 35  years old and the realization is really painful because I know that I would have long been married; I would have married before I was 24 years old.
Now, it appears like I am in a wasteland, rotting away.

As I think of my predicament, even now, I feel like a barrage of tears streaming down on my face; such a sweet story that has eventually turned tragic.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://cdn-pro.elsalvador.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/07030819/1465484281202.jpg

I feel the emptiness of my life, hollow and dark and I feel a sense of utter despair. I know so well but I no longer have the controlling muscles over it.

I feel so sad as my mind goes on this journey of recollection, travelling down memory lane as I recall the first time I meet Bosun. That was twelve years ago, I was 22 and I had just gone for the national youth service scheme, having graduated at the a
root_title: There Is Usually A Reward For Being Greedy; Script 1

author: mojubare
title: Voice; A Simple Poem
body:
https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/1/16/Miss_Nigeria_07_Munachi_Abii.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwiPoPrR14_ZAhXSLlAKHTuFA8YQjRx6BAgAEAY&url=https%3A%2F%2Fcommons.wikimedia.org%2Fwiki%2FFile%3AMiss_Nigeria_07_Munachi_Abii.jpg&psig=AOvVaw3C6tX6InmZRIaBx1vjW4GC&ust=1517920735125801)
 
Look up" i heard a silent voice interupting me
    lingering in his thought, quietness in my heart
    i thought of the voice that arouse me
    dont speak to me am already mine
    fighting back the silly voice
    my heart is scattered within me
    but the voice is so pleasing, his look is really mine 
    i thought right inside of me , which mine is mine
    travelling down the lane with you
    today the same voice still whispers to me
root_title: Voice; A Simple Poem

author: mojubare
title: Mama's Nanny Is My Nanny
body:
https://i1.wp.com/www.learning-mind.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/positive-thinking-benefits.jpg

Nanny a good nan,
Back bent sagging,
Stepping quick as snail,
Gentle with speech,
Strong hands wrinkled,
Wakes up early for duty,
Clothes straight with edges,
Appearing in her fine state,
Happy baby she cares,
Cheering everyone around,
Seen good old days,
Forget new names,
Collects familiar faces,
Blessed with good strong eyes,
Smiles to lighten burden,
Baby loves Nan,
Mama loves Nan.
root_title: Mama's Nanny Is My Nanny

author: mojubare
title: My Short Poem
body:
We belong to Adam,
We belong to Eve,
Our bounds know no trust,
Our gathering searches for truth.

Our infidelity had root,
Our hearts have been broken,
Our eyes have been enlightened,
We play games,
Decipher your code.

Yet I know all activities within,
My mysterious hole,

My good door.

body:
He has been pestering me about it but I told him what he is asking for is not in my power to grant but by a collective acceptance of the cabinet members. “He can now speak to us” the king permitted him to speak.
Ekeh arose.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

“I greet you elders of Ijoko Kingdom”
“We greet our son, they responded.”

My father has shared my testimony with you. So I’m to speak about my ministry with you and the doctrine I came with. I want build a church and a school in this kingdom. I’m a pastor and have seen the reason for my people to also need to accept the same God I’m serving” said Ekeh

“What is he talking about? What is church and what is pastor? Were the question the elders were asking each other.
root_title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 11

author: mojubare
title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 10
body:
"I have even tried to convince the people of the importance of Thanksgiving yet they show stinginess" complained Isiaja 
"So what do we do? asked Ijoka
"That's why I came. I have come up with an idea" said Isiaja

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

"An idea, so what is it?"ijoka asked Isiaja
Isiaja whispered into Ijoka ear.
"Eh! ifa festival?" ijoka asked in puzzlement
"Yes that's the only way we can acquire greatness snd live about poverty" said Isiaja


Ijoka thought about it for a moment.
"I think that is a good idea. That's what will be good for this stingy people." said ijoka
"So how are we going to do this?"  Ijoka asked Isiaja

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

"Just trust me and leave everything for me. Am i no longer the wind that never get trapped? Just come to my place on the next Eke market day and then i will tell you how it goes" said Isiaja to ijoka

"Alright, great one" s

author: mojubare
title: Enjoy What You Do; If You Don't Enjoy It, Don't Do It
body:
Starting anything at all requires a high input of time, energy, money and hard work. These things aren't easy to sacrifice on a platter of gold.

Putting yourself into something you do not love. When you intend to do things, they should be things you are proud of, things you can get creative minds to work with you and get things done.

http://grandhealthacademy.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/gha-slider-9-1350x720.jpg?x76912
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwjVqr2MlfDYAhVCalAKHajVDNIQjRx6BAgAEAY&url=http%3A%2F%2Fgrandhealthacademy.com%2Fnews%2Fbenefits-of-private-career-colleges%2F&psig=AOvVaw1qdqiy0LcmpXpkWp5Q0aDN&ust=1516868282289217)

When you about to start something, you are a blank canvas that do not know what to be filled, but your passion and love for what you do gets you a result that fills the canvas.

If you do not appreciate and like the reason you do a thing, then do not get involved at all because it will be giving a negative res
root_title: Enjoy What You Do; If You Don't Enjoy It, Don't Do It

author: mojubare
title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 9
body:
I means the offering and sacrifices the people were bringing. People do not even care or bother if I the chief priest and my family eat or not. 

My children are getting malnourished each day, nothing to eat. Could you imagine that I now eat food without meat I don't know if you're experiencing the same thing?" Isiaja asked Ijoka and Ijoka laughed.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

" I even think that I am the only one that is suffering this. I didn't even know that they are doing the same thing to you. This is not how our fathers were treated by the people. The people are now becoming stingy and ungrateful.

"I have thought about this severally and I even said that I will come to your lace to know if you are observing the same thing." Said Ijoka.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg
root_title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 9

title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 8
body:
https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg
"This root should be from Ozara forest" Isiaja presumed.
"Exactly, you are absolutely correct" said Ijoka to Isiaja.
"Please let me get you kol so that we can eat" Ijoka added

"Alright" responded Isiaja
Ijoka went ahead to his hut and brought out Kola nut and they started sharing and eating. They assimilated the Kola with a keg of Palm wine.
"Hmmm, thank you very much Ijoka" Isiaja appreciated Ijoka
"You are welcome" replied Ijoka

"There is something important I came to share with you and I believe you will not show disapproval" said Isiaja
"What is it, great one?" Ijoka asked
"I don't know whether what I am experiencing and passing through is also coming your way?" Isiaja and Ijoka
"I don't understand, what do you mean? Ijoka asked in eagerness and puzzlement.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

"Ehem! I've remembered something. I believe this one will fetch a lot of good things. I have the power and I can do it. By the way, it is still from me that people will want to make enquiry concerning it. I will welcome back and instigate the Ifa festival which was being long abolished.

Yes, this is a good and great idea. It was this festival that made the former chief priests wealthy but to do this, I have to connive with Ijoka and I believe he will be in support of the idea. "That is it" Isiaja said to himself

In the evening of that day, Isiaja went to Ijoka's house and he met him as he was peeling some herbal roots. Ijoka saw him and rose

" I greet you great one" Ijoka greeted Isiaja
"I greet you, eyes of the gods" Isija replied
"Please sit down" Ijoka offered Isiaja a seat and he sat down.
"Thank you, it's like you are preparing some medicine" Said Isiaja
"Yes, great one"replied Ijoka
Isiaja took one of the

author: mojubare
title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 6
body:
https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg


My forefather who practice this priest of a thing did not lack anything. There was adequate and surplus food for them from the people. But in our turn the people has become stingy. They refuse to bring thanksgiving offerings to the gods. Do they even think that they were making greatness by their own power and wisdom?

Upon the orientation, I've being passing, trying to stir them to pay thanksgivings to the gods yet all that I said fell on deaf ears. Do they want us to perish to hunger? it has come to a stage that I can't even find meat in my soup anymore. Ijoka the second priest is also complaining of the some thing. 

I think it is time to do something. What shall i do to get rich? should I inflict them with pains snd sicknesses. After a deep thought, he knew that wasn't possible. 

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg
root_title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 6

author: mojubare
title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 5
body:
https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

Isiaja came out from his shrine and went home. He sat on his wooden chair and leaned his back on the crossing chair long back. His wife came out with food and laid on top of the wooden stool.

"My husband here is your food," she said to Isiaja. "Have the children eaten?" Isiaja asked her. "Yes, my husband" she replied and went away.

Isiaja opened the soup and the soup was pale with not soup at all, no crayfish, meat or snail. there was nothing at all. He looked up and down and shook his head uncontrollably. He doesn't know whether to close the food or to eat the food. After some moments of thought, he put down the cover of the plate and washed his hand. He had no choice but to eat the food.

He called his wife who came to clear to the table and took away the plate.Isiaja laid his legs on the stool where the food was laid before and he learned his back to the chair again. he put his hand on his head as he faced up
root_title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 5

author: mojubare
title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 4
body:
https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

He did it to show how much he loved his people. After the sacrifice, the festival stopped. No drumming, Dancing or singing was heard again. After the sacrifice, the people promised to keep the kingship for his lineage only. Ever since king Ukanna lineage has been ruling the Ijoko Kingdom. Before the festival was stopped, anytime is was the festive period, people usually envy the priests and most people wanted to be priests.

One day, Isiaja was in his house and he was moody and worried. Isisaja was the head chief priest of Ijoko Kingdom. There were two chief priests in Ijoko KIngdom that the people go to for enquiries. Isiaja was worried with the situation of his family; his children were getting malnourished as a result of inadequate of food in the house.

The people of Ijoko kingdom were no longr bringing sacrifices or items of thanksgiving like before. Isiaja had even tried to create awareness on the importance
root_title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 4

title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 3
body:
https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

At the last day of that month the people of Ijoko will then bring their sacrificial items to the gods and offered by the people to their bns. The cheif priest of that time never lack foods, whether there is famine in the land or not, it does not concern them. 

No one dared question the chief priests or accused them of anything because th practice has been revealed from different chief priests from different kingdoms that the festival was from the gods and not the chief priests that manipulated it.

It was said that the festival was a punishment to the kingdom for what their anscestors did against the gods. So king Ukanna offered his daughter as a sacrifice to the gods. aHe doesn't want to bother anyoneor ask his people to provide the virgin girl for the sacrifice.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

author: mojubare
title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 4
body:
The previously passed chief refused to unveil the measure on which that strange tradition will be abolished because the tradition was for their interest.

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

The custom falls on the fourth and ninth month of every year. During these moments, in the night when everyone has gone to sleep the spirits will appear at kingdom's gathering hall. They will be beating drums and singing songs that cannot be understood by humans.

The people of Ijoko kingdom always got frightened during those days and the festival of the spirits will be observed by the spirit everyday for the particular months it fell on.

___
___
https://steemitimages.com/DQmcGTgE9ztQ7QmWESyE7uVqLrUqfbAa1fsTCod6dmsFYjP/GENERIC.gif

author: mojubare
title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 3
body:
https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

The chief priest was good to his people and was not in support of that sudden and strange tradition even before his appointment as chief priest. He was the one who gave the king the idea of where he can get solution for his people but he told him that it was not a small task.

The chief priest was not after the riches the gods has given through that practice rather he was concerned with the happiness of the people.

The king was the only person eligible by tradition to embark on such journey. The previously passed chief refused to unveil the measure on which that strange tradition will be abolished because the tradition was for their interest. 

https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

author: mojubare
title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 2
body:
https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

This practice lingered until when a brave king emerged from the kingdom. His name was Ukanna. During his reign as king, he arose to seek measures to put an end to the unusual festival they were observing that made the people in the kingdom unhappy.

When the people attempted to violate the festival by foresaking it, calamity will visit the land thereby calling for appeasement of the gods. The practice continued for 10 years until king Ukanna left hie kingdom to seek solution and relief for the people in his kingdom. King Ukanna on his return came back with two bulls from the land of the spirits which he sacrificed as he was commanded and the strange custom  ends. 

King Ukenna was formally a warrior in the land of Ijoko. During the 10 years of king Ukanna's vacation, the throne was empty and nobody was recrowned king. The chief priest were in charge of telling the people about how the king was doing in the spirit
root_title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 2

author: mojubare
title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 1
body:
https://s.hswstatic.com/gif/two-ways-to-count-to-ten-story-1.jpg

The kingdom of Ijoko has been a serene place to live. The people of the kingdom had been living in peace, harmony and unity. The people have breathed the breath of relief and comfort for the past 3 century when their ancestors were subjected to a particular festivity which was imposed by their gods.



The festival is meant to be an annual occasion and observed two times in a year, where the entire people gather 30% of their farm produce and offer it to the chief priests as sacrificial items to the gods for two quarters of the year. Soon the chief priests became rich as so many people brought 30% of the chief priests. 

The chief priest became the wealthest people in the kingdom as they were been enriched by the villagers. The people of Ijoko then never worried but after 300 years, the people became fed up of the practice and they started agitating and protesting against it but nothing could be done since they were mandated by their gods to do
root_title: The People Of Ijoko; episode 1

author: mojubare
title: Are Beggers Trully Beggers or Another Well Paid Job
body:
Every day, I go from home to my destination, I see beggars around begging around the street. This is now a major concern to why people with complete legs and hand, not physically disabled and living healthy will decide to start begging for alms using the alms to enrich themselves. 

http://newsweekpakistan.com/daisnews/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/Begging.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiFm8KYr_DXAhXDbFAKHc2uASMQjRwIBw&url=http%3A%2F%2Fnewsweekpakistan.com%2Fdespite-new-laws-no-change-in-pakistans-begging-business%2F&psig=AOvVaw3ME2H-m6MsiE51Dlf-Po9z&ust=1512477293162067)

So many of them make thousands of Naira daily through rip off and playing on the intelligence of others. There was a man close to our house then, he always wakes up very early in the money and goes to his so-called office. The man owns two cars, one bus, and a house. He is Okay, I mean he lives in the average class category but no one knew his job.

http://www.hindustan
root_title: Are Beggers Trully Beggers or Another Well Paid Job

author: mojubare
title: Handling Ambition Issues
body:
How do we orientate ourselves with respect to ambition correctly? Desire in the question is synonymous with the word ambition. All aspirations and pursuits should be placed on proper priority. This implies you make every your ambition should be scrutinized in the light of the affection of your goals and pursuit.

https://i.imgur.com/jGwDTpL.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjc1d3J_-vXAhXNJlAKHYlZA3kQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fambition.com%2F&psig=AOvVaw2NUe8g62wav9DpJsl8E_AN&ust=1512327073647655)

Never you forget that you have to jettison any thought of you being able to achieve anything on your own. So, we should pursue our ambition within the parameters of our goals. Ambition wants all of us to move very fast in the fast lane of life.

http://www.edwindearborn.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/18747660_ml.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiMl5P8_-vXAhVEK1AKHUgLBXQQjRwIBw

author: mojubare
title: What You Need To Have Instead Of Self-Discipline
body:
Discipline is important to every fact of life. For example, discipline comes with patience, one cannot pursue his/her goals in life within the parameters of their faith if they do not possess self-discipline.

You cannot fight against ignorance. To be truthful, no one enjoys discipline. You cannot enjoy being disciplined! NO one enjoys waking up very early to go to work and start a hectic day. Though it is one of the most difficult things to do yet it is one of the profitable and rewarding things to do. 

https://bestpreschoolinkolkata.files.wordpress.com/2014/06/playschools-teach-effective-discipline.jpg

author: mojubare
title: Cascade Of Goals, Objective and Priority In Daily Activities
body:
Goals, Objective and priority. These three things are major and dominant when it comes to time management and getting something valuable from your daily activity. Do you know that, if you prioritize your daily activities without a clear goal, you will be starting a fruitless journey? If you set a clear goal and objective without prioritising your activities properly, you will be seeing only visions that cannot be achieved in a lifetime.

So the first thing to do is to know where these things stand and which comes first before the other. 

## GOALS
Goals are strategic plans that focus on a definite endpoint which do not cut through obstacles and downs. Goals are first things of the mind as they are designed in the mind then they are put down in books or pads so they can be followed accordingly.

https://media.giphy.com/media/kAZJ8tSvH1DeU/200.gif
[gif](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwimvu2JjeHXAhUBU1AKHaDJBnwQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fgiphy.com%2Fstic
root_title: Cascade Of Goals, Objective and Priority In Daily Activities

author: mojubare
title: Disrespect In Relationship
body:
Loving is a beautiful experience and easy fall in. At the beginning, everyone (lovers) tend to do everything the right way, they do not find mistakes in all they do. The guy starts covering for every mistake the woman makes to every other person, the same also goes for the woman. They enjoy their first part of the relationship but then they get to the next face where they start seeing each other's flaws and then they start taking things too personally.

https://thumb1.shutterstock.com/display_pic_with_logo/631318/499916254/stock-photo-disrespectful-red-rubber-stamp-over-a-white-background-499916254.jpg

author: mojubare
title: It Is In Your Hands Not Mine
body:
My grandfather is known for telling stories which are known to be beautiful and full of wisdom. He is known to be the wisest old man in his community, so let me tell you one of the stories he told me. The story goes does.

Long, long ago, there was a land in the ancient days of Joseph the Pharaoh of Egypt. There was an old man who lived in a house on a hill, he was known to be the wisest, most experienced, most intelligent and brave man. People believe that his wisdom which is uncomparable made him live in the cave so he will not be disturbed.

People from great kingdoms, big, small, rich and poor, they all come to visit this man and ask

author: mojubare
title: You Can Be Totally Right But Wrong At The Top Of Your Voice
body:
One day, I was talking to my friend. He was explaining to me about how he was beating by the Nigerian police because he was rude to them. Although, he was on his right but was wrong because he was at the top of his voice. He was totally wrong because he attacked the issue wrongly.

https://c2.staticflickr.com/4/3286/2916813731_8d9e648733_b.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjUsdjc38_XAhXFVRQKHZTvCuEQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.flickr.com%2Fphotos%2Fiamkat%2F2916813731&psig=AOvVaw3WU0pp90WxjF4rne3c3VCI&ust=1511356461018832)

Knowing your right is a different thing, carefully laying it out is another thing. This same thing goes as far as relationships, friendships and so on. So many people might be right and be sincere, in fact, you might offend someone but the manner in which the person will relate the issue might make them wrong.

https://media.licdn.com/mpr/mpr/p/1/005/0b8/289/319fa84.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=

author: mojubare
title: Clarity Is Key In Life
body:
Most people do so many things and then they make mistakes after which they tell you they didn't understand what they were meant to do or perform. The starting point for success in a person's life is clarity. Clarity about where you are going, how you are to go about it, what you are meant to look for when you get there and so on.

http://thecontextofthings.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/clarity.png
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwimocTT0MvXAhVF6xQKHYy1DukQjRwIBw&url=http%3A%2F%2Fthecontextofthings.com%2F2015%2F06%2F02%2Ffuture-of-work-clarity-empowerment%2F&psig=AOvVaw19u6WkWSbqxqOxxo-nmmYB&ust=1511214906075642)

I have heard of people who win contracts they do not know how to execute them then I ask why the contract was awarded to them.

How will you know what you are meant to do when you do not know the recommended output you are meant to give. When you know where you are meant to be, then getting there won't be much difficult.

http://bn
root_title: Clarity Is Key In Life

author: mojubare
title: How I Felt Refreshed After I Stole Orange Heart
body:
You might have been thinking that orange doesn't deserve this, but trust me she does. From the rings on her toes, down to the tiny leg chains around her legs, down to her bottled body. Reasons, why I love her is because of her long, spreading hands and arms that around her.

http://l7.alamy.com/zooms/960c951836554c129f4dc84d99553b8c/orange-tree-valencia-bearing-fruit-bghm4d.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwi63f64gsXXAhVEuhQKHZMODS0QjRwIBw&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.alamy.com%2Fstock-photo%2Forange-tree-citrus-sinensis.html&psig=AOvVaw21HcZPL_PBA1CJJloCznHe&ust=1510987798189988)

If she had no solid and rigid stem, how would she had stood high so she could be a generous giver. Kind hearted, never forsaking others when she is rich to give out. She gives her fruit to all who is thirsty.

 How I love you orange, I just stole your heart and you have to look for it.
root_title: How I Felt Refreshed After I Stole Orange Heart

author: mojubare
title: Royal Ethics and Royal Dynasty
body:
I will be talking about the ethics of kings. It is said that kings are to carry themselves in the discharge of kingly authority. The ethics of kings moderate and govern their behaviours and it ought to be consistent with their nature.

https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2010/05/istockcrown.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiAldrA3sHXAhXHzRQKHSMwC8oQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Ftechcrunch.com%2F2012%2F08%2F19%2Fthe-consumer-is-king-record-4b-raised-in-mobile-vc-in-the-first-half-of-2012-more-than-25-in-consumer-apps%2F&psig=AOvVaw2osOP-hd1XelvmkrhdSuKz&ust=1510873544222975)

Kings are associated with kingly life and glory. Kings are not meant to transgress in judgement which means that a king is not meant to tell lies or how respect for anyone while judging. A king ought not to be biased or partial during judgment. A king is not meant to steal or make rules when intoxicated.

author: mojubare
title: Developing A Success Vocabulary
body:
Success is not an accident or a mistake, it is a product of deliberate actions. Everything that occurs on this planet is based on deliberate action and that covers both success and failure. The rules that govern the universe are intentional rules and principles aimed at achieving intentional results. To think that anything achieved is an accident is to deceive oneself.

author: mojubare
title: Even An Aged Man Is A Youth
body:
http://www.myeducorner.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/1-24.jpg

Have you taken time to imagine a world without youth, that means there will be a world without a future because youths are the future. If there is a nation without youth, then there is a nation without a vision, a nation without a drive. Youths are the evidence of a productive past and a prosperous future. A nation without youth will be less active, vibrant and it will be dull.

## Who are youths?
Youths are people not of the same age group and range. They are young adults with strength, the ability to do adventures that lack the experience of matured humans. Youth is said to be the transition stage between childhood and adulthood. Although some people believe that being a youth does not have anything to do with age, rather it has to do with having a heart and mind of continuous progress which is also called hope. It is believed that youths are known to be filled with hope and at that they have a growing mind. So it is believed that if you have

author: mojubare

body:
Faith is the foundation of a successful life; it is the substance of all that you need both financially, materially, spiritually and in life generally. Faith in God is the certainty and evidence of all you stand and believe to enjoy in the lord. Do you know your faith is what made you what you are now? Yes!! your faith is what made you, therefore, your faith is what made you. Your conviction about the way you want thing t to be for you is how they be for you.
